title: Pithla Bhakri
instructions: Mix 1 cup besan with 2 cups water to form a smooth paste, no lumps.;Heat oil in a pan. Add mustard seeds and curry leaves. Let them splutter.;Add chopped onion, green chilies, and garlic. Sauté till soft.;Pour in the besan paste. Stir continuously on medium heat.;Cook for 8–10 minutes till thickened. Add turmeric and salt.;Serve hot with bhakri or roti.

title: Sabudana Khichdi
instructions: Soak sabudana in water for 2–3 hours until soft but not mushy.;Peel and dice potatoes. Roast peanuts lightly.;Heat ghee in a pan. Add cumin seeds and chopped green chili.;Add potatoes and sauté for 5 minutes.;Mix in soaked sabudana and peanuts. Cook on low flame for 8 minutes.;Add salt and drop of lemon juice. Serve hot.

title: Puran Poli
instructions: Roast chana dal until golden, then grind to fine powder.;Cook dal powder with grated jaggery and cardamom until thick like halwa.;Make soft dough with flour, water, and a little ghee.;Roll small balls of dough, flatten, fill with puran, then roll again into a disc.;Cook on tawa with ghee until golden brown on both sides.

title: Batata Bhaji
instructions: Peel and dice potatoes into small cubes.;Heat oil in a pan. Add mustard seeds and curry leaves.;Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent.;Add potatoes, turmeric, and salt. Stir to coat.;Cover and cook on low flame till potatoes are soft.;Uncover and fry for 5 more minutes till edges crisp.

title: Misal Pav
instructions: Soak moth beans overnight, then pressure cook till soft.;In oil, fry fennel seeds, garlic, green chilies.;Add chopped tomatoes and cook till mushy.;Add cooked beans, tamarind paste, and spice mix. Simmer 10 minutes.;Garnish with onions, coriander, lemon juice.;Serve with toasted pav.

title: Modak
instructions: Make dough with rice flour and warm water. Knead into soft dough.;Grate coconut, mix with jaggery and cardamom powder. Cook until dry.;Roll small balls of dough, flatten into cups.;Fill with coconut-jaggery mix, then pleat edges to form a mound.;Steam for 10–12 minutes. Serve warm.

title: Thalipeeth
ingredients: multigrain flour (jowar, bajra, rice, chickpea),onion,green chili,coriander,spice mix (bhaji masala),oil,water
instructions: Mix all flours with salt and bhaji masala.;Add finely chopped onions, green chilies, and coriander.;Add water little by little to make firm dough.;Divide into balls, flatten into thick discs.;Cook on tawa with oil on both sides till golden.

title: Zunka Bhakri
instructions: Roast besan in a pan on low heat for 5–7 minutes until fragrant.;In another pan, heat oil. Sauté onions, green chilies, turmeric.;Mix roasted besan with sautéed mixture. Add chopped coriander.;Add water to make a thick, moist mix. Cook for 10 minutes.;Serve steaming hot with bhakri and pickles.

title: Dahi Bhath
ingredients: rice,curd,water,salt,mustard seeds,curry leaves,dry red chili,coconut,green chili,coriander
instructions: Cook rice and cool to room temperature.;Whisk curd with water to make a thin, tangy mix.;In tempering: heat oil. Add mustard seeds, curry leaves, red chili.;Mix tempering into curd-rice. Add grated coconut, chopped green chili.;Salt to taste. Garnish with coriander. Serve chilled.

title: Varan Bhat
instructions: Pressure cook toor dal with turmeric and salt until soft.;In a pan, heat ghee. Add cumin and asafoetida. Let them sizzle.;Pour dal tempering over cooked dal. Mix well.;Serve hot with rice and a drizzle of ghee on top.

title: Amabhar
instructions: Boil cluster beans till tender, then cool and chop.;In oil, sauté green chilies and turmeric.;Add tamarind pulp and jaggery. Simmer until thick sauce forms.;Add chopped beans. Cook till flavors meld.;Garnish with fresh coriander. Served cold as side dish.

title: Kharria
instructions: Roast bajra flour in ghee on low flame for 10 mins until aromatic.;Boil jaggery with water to make syrup. Cool slightly.;Mix roasted flour into syrup until dough forms.;Add cardamom powder. Knead till smooth.;Form into small balls. Traditionally eaten with milk.

title: Ukdiche Modak
instructions: Make dough with rice flour and warm water.;Cook grated coconut with jaggery until dry & fragrant. Add cardamom.;Roll small dough balls, flatten into cups, fill with coconut mix.;Pleat closed, place in steamer. Steam for 12 minutes.

title: Pav Bhaji
instructions: Boil and mash potatoes, peas, capsicum, tomato, onion.;Heat butter. Add pav bhaji masala. Stir 2 minutes.;Add mashed vegetables. Cook on high flame till dry.;Add chopped coriander. Mash again with spoon.;Toast pav with butter. Serve hot with onions and lemon.

title: Aam Chutney
instructions: Peel and chop raw mango into small pieces.;Grind with roasted cumin powder, salt, red chili powder.;Add jaggery and little water. Blend to paste.;Store in glass jar. Use with meals or puran poli.

title: Karela Bhaji
instructions: Slice bitter gourd thinly, soak in saltwater for 10 mins.;Drain and pat dry.;Heat oil. Add mustard seeds and turmeric. Sizzle.;Add onions and sauté. Then add bitter gourd.;Cook covered till soft. Season with salt. Serve warm.

title: Shrikhand
instructions: Hang curd in muslin cloth for 6–8 hours till thick.;Mix with sugar, powdered cardamom, and soaked saffron strands.;Chill for 2 hours.;Garnish with chopped almonds or pistachios. Serve cold.

title: Bhakri
instructions: Mix jowar flour with water and salt to make stiff dough.;Divide into balls. Roll into thick flatbreads using palm.;Cook on tawa until browned on both sides.;Can be baked on open fire for smoky flavor.

title: Kanda Pudina Bhaji
instructions: Thinly slice onions.;Heat oil. Add turmeric and chili flakes. Sauté 1 min.;Add onions. Cook till soft and slightly brown.;Add chopped mint leaves. Toss gently.;Cook 2 more minutes. Serve warm.

title: Kobichi Bharli Fasal
instructions: Shred cabbage finely.;Mix with besan, turmeric, salt, and little water to make thick paste.;Heat oil. Add mustard seeds and curry leaves.;Add cabbage paste. Cook on medium heat till crisp.;Served as side dish with dal-bhakri.

title: Rassa
instructions: Marinate chicken in curd and spice powders for 1 hour.;Sauté onions, garlic, ginger till browned.;Add chicken and sear on high heat.;Add tamarind pulp, garam masala, water. Simmer 30 mins.;Garnish with coriander. Served with rice.

title: Bhindi Bhaji
instructions: Trim okra and slice into rounds. Dry on cloth.;Heat oil. Add mustard seeds and hing. Sizzle.;Add turmeric, then okra. Cook covered on low heat.;Stir occasionally till okra is soft and dry.;Serve with bhakri or roti.

title: Khichdi
instructions: Wash rice and moong dal. Mix in equal parts.;Boil with water and turmeric until soft.;In separate pan, heat ghee. Add cumin seeds.;Pour tempering over khichdi. Mix well.;Serve hot, with pickle and yogurt.

title: Shiropa
instructions: Roast vermicelli in ghee till golden.;Add milk and sugar. Cook on low flame till thick.;Add crushed cardamom and chopped dry fruits.;Cook until all milk is absorbed.;Chill and serve as sweet or dessert.

title: Masale Bhat
instructions: Cook rice till slightly underdone.;Heat oil. Add mustard seeds, curry leaves, chopped onions.;Add chopped tomato, turmeric, red chili. Cook till oil separates.;Mix in cooked rice. Toss gently.;Add crushed roasted peanuts and coriander. Serve hot.

title: Pavachi Bhaji
instructions: Dice potato, onion, and bell pepper.;Sauté in oil with spices and tomato.;Cook until vegetables soften.;Serve hot with toasted pav.

title: Saggus
instructions: Mix jowar flour with curd and water to make thick batter.;Let sit for 1 hour.;Heat oil. Add mustard seeds, chopped green chili.;Pour batter and cook on low flame till set.;Top with fried peanuts and coriander.

title: Akki Roti
instructions: Mix rice flour with grated carrot, onion, green chili, coriander.;Add water and salt to make dough.;Roll into thin discs.;Cook on tawa with oil till golden.

title: Telichi Bharli Gobhi
instructions: Cut cauliflower into florets.;Mix gram flour with water, turmeric, salt to make paste.;Coat cauliflower in paste.;Fry in oil until golden.;Temper with mustard seeds and curry leaves.

title: Pelat
instructions: Grate green mango.;Heat oil. Add mustard seeds, curry leaves.;Add grated mango, jaggery, chili, salt.;Cook until soft and syrupy. Stir often.;Serve as chutney with bhakri.

title: Bhat Bhaaji
instructions: Cook rice separately.;In oil, sauté onion and tomato.;Add diced potato and peas. Cook till soft.;Mix in cooked rice. Add turmeric and salt.;Cook 5 min till flavors blend.

title: Papad Bhaji
instructions: Fry papad until crisp. Keep aside.;Heat oil. Add mustard seeds, curry leaves, green chili.;Add chopped onion and turmeric. Sauté.;Shred papad and mix in. Cook 2 min.;Garnish with coriander. Serve instantly.

title: Kanda Amti
instructions: Pressure cook toor dal until soft.;Heat ghee. Add mustard seeds, cumin, onions.;Add tamarind pulp and cooked dal. Simmer.;Add turmeric and salt. Cook for 10 min.;Serve with rice or bhakri.

title: Bharli Vangi
instructions: Cut eggplant into halves, scoop out flesh.;Mix pulp with curd, mint, coriander, shallots, spices.;Stuff back into eggplant halves.;Steam for 15 minutes.;Temper with oil and red chili.

title: Ukadiche Modak (Soft)
instructions: Make dough with rice flour and warm water.;Cook coconut and jaggery together until dry.;Roll dough into cups, fill with coconut mix, pleat tops.;Steam for 12 minutes. Serve warm.

title: Batata Saar
instructions: Boil and mash potatoes.;Heat oil. Add mustard seeds, curry leaves.;Add tamarind pulp and water. Simmer.;Add mashed potatoes, turmeric, salt.;Garnish with coriander. Serve hot.

title: Kandachi Bhakri
instructions: Mix jowar flour with grated onion, green chili, coriander, salt.;Add water to make stiff dough.;Roll into thick rotis.;Cook on tawa with oil till browned.

title: Pohe
instructions: Rinse pohe lightly and let drain.;Heat oil. Add mustard seeds, curry leaves, onion.;Add turmeric, peanuts. Sauté.;Add pohe, salt. Mix gently.;Finish with lemon and coriander. Serve hot.

title: Kande Khaati
instructions: Thinly slice onions.;Heat ghee and oil. Add cumin seeds.;Add onions. Fry slowly till golden brown.;Add turmeric and salt.;Serve as side with rice or bhakri.

title: Oats Shivaji
instructions: Cook oats in water until soft.;Sauté onions, chili, vegetables in oil.;Add turmeric and salt.;Mix with cooked oats.;Serve hot as porridge.

title: Kadhi
instructions: Whisk yogurt with water and besan until smooth.;In a pan, heat oil. Add mustard seeds, curry leaves, cumin.;Add turmeric and salt.;Pour yogurt mixture. Cook on low flame till thick.;Serve hot with rice.

title: Vangi Masala
instructions: Roast eggplant over fire until soft.;Chop tomato and onion.;Sauté in oil with spice mix and curry leaves.;Add roasted eggplant. Mix gently.;Cook 5 min until well blended.

title: Baingan Bharta
instructions: Roast eggplant till charred and soft.;Peel skin and mash.;Sauté onion, tomato, garlic, chili in oil.;Add mashed eggplant and garam masala.;Cook 10 min. Garnish with coriander.

title: Pulav
instructions: Soak rice for 30 minutes.;Sauté onions, carrots, potatoes.;Add peas, turmeric, garam masala.;Add rice and water. Cook covered.;Fluff with fork. Serve hot.

title: Farsan
instructions: Mix chickpea flour with water, salt, turmeric, asafoetida.;Slowly heat oil. Add mustard seeds, curry leaves.;Pour batter in tiny streams into hot oil.;Fry until crisp. Drain and cool.;Store for snacks.

title: Sukhi Sabji
instructions: Slice bottle gourd paper-thin.;Heat oil. Add mustard seeds, curry leaves.;Add gourd. Sauté till crispy.;Add turmeric, salt. Cook till dry.;Serve as crunchy side.

title: Kanda Aloo Sabji
instructions: Dice onions and potatoes.;Heat oil. Add mustard seeds, curry leaves.;Sauté onions till translucent.;Add potatoes, turmeric, salt.;Cook covered until tender.

title: Dhania Pankan
instructions: Blend coriander with green chili.;Mix with gram flour, salt, turmeric.;Add water to make thick batter.;Fry spoonfuls in oil till golden.;Serve as crispy fritters.

title: Bhakri with tilt
instructions: Make chutney: roast sesame seeds, grind with onion, chili, salt.;Serve warm bhakri with sesame chutney.;Ideal for winter months.

title: Kolhapuri Chicken Curry
instructions: Marinate chicken in chili powder and coconut.;Sauté onion, garlic, ginger.;Add tomato and spice mix. Cook well.;Add chicken, water. Simmer 40 min.;Serve with rice or puri.

title: Kheer
instructions: Cook rice in milk until soft.;Add jaggery, cardamom powder.;Cook until thick. Stir often.;Add chopped nuts and ghee.;Cool and serve chilled.

title: Pheni
instructions: Mix flour with water to make dough.;Roll into thin strands and coil into nests.;Fry in ghee until golden.;Soak in sugar syrup with cardamom and saffron.;Cool and serve.

title: Kanda Amti
instructions: Cook toor dal till soft.;In ghee, fry mustard seeds, cumin, onion.;Add tamarind and cooked dal.;Simmer for 10 minutes.;Serve with rice.

title: Modak Amti
instructions: Cook toor dal till soft.;In oil, temper mustard seeds and curry leaves.;Add jaggery, coconut, turmeric.;Mix with dal. Simmer 10 min.;Serve with steamed rice.

title: Tambada Patto
instructions: Clean and cut liver into pieces.;Sauté garlic, ginger, onion.;Add tomato and red chili.;Add liver and turmeric. Cook 15 min.;Serve with bhakri.
